params._fee: - node operator price per API call / data request
params._job_Id: - specific job for :_operator: to run; each job is unique and returns different types of data
params._link_Token: - LINK token address on the corresponding network
params._operator: - address of the specific Chainlink node that a contract makes an API call from

params._user: - the user to retrieve verification status for.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._baseApi: - Set the base URL to perform the GET request on
params._path: - the path to walk when an api call is made

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

constructor.notice: Executes once when a contract is created to initialize state variables

fulfillHumanityStatus(bytes32,string).notice: Receive the response in the form of a string

getVerificationStatus(address).notice: get the users verification status (approved, declined, pending ...)

requestHumanityStatus().notice: Create a Chainlink request to retrieve API response, and find the target (status).

withdrawLink().notice: Allow the withdrawal of Link tokens from the contract

userdoc.notice: Request testnet LINK and ETH here: https://faucets.chain.link/ Find information on LINK Token Contracts and get the latest ETH and LINK faucets here: https://docs.chain.link/docs/link-token-contracts/ Run your own chainlink Node and deploy an operator contract: https://docs.chain.link/docs/running-a-chainlink-node/
